Class BIFParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • BIFParser

  • public class BIFParser
extends java.lang.Object
    A Bison parser, automatically generated from BIFParser.y.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static int YYERROR
      Returned by a Bison action in order to start error recovery without printing an error message.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void defineProbability(BIFParser.StringList variableNames, BIFParser.ProbabilityContentEntryList entries)
      entries is a List of: ProbabilityEntry or ProbabilityDefaultEntry or ProbabilityTable
      protected void defineProbabilityTableEntry(CPT cpt, Assignment x, java.util.List<RandomVariable> parents, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Double> ptvalues)
      Recursively traverses parents in the order they were declared (ie., their order in the list), iterating through each of their values, assigning probabilities from ptvalues at the leaves.
      protected void defineVariable(java.lang.String name, BIFParser.VariableContentItemList items)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BIFParser

        public BIFParser(BIFParser.Lexer yylexer)
        Instantiates the Bison-generated parser.
        Parameters:
        yylexer - The scanner that will supply tokens to the parser.

      • BIFParser

        public BIFParser(java.io.InputStream input)
        Construct and return a new BIFParser whose input is the given InputStream. Invokes automatically-generated constructor that takes a Lexer as parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • getDebugStream

        public final java.io.PrintStream getDebugStream()
        Return the PrintStream on which the debugging output is printed.

        public final void setDebugStream(java.io.PrintStream s)
        Set the PrintStream on which the debug output is printed.
        Parameters:
        s - The stream that is used for debugging output.

      • getDebugLevel

        public final int getDebugLevel()
        Answer the verbosity of the debugging output; 0 means that all kinds of output from the parser are suppressed.

      • setDebugLevel

        public final void setDebugLevel(int level)
        Set the verbosity of the debugging output; 0 means that all kinds of output from the parser are suppressed.
        Parameters:
        level - The verbosity level for debugging output.

      • yyerror

        protected final void yyerror(java.lang.String s)

      • yycdebug

        protected final void yycdebug(java.lang.String s)

      • recovering

        public final boolean recovering()
        Return whether error recovery is being done. In this state, the parser reads token until it reaches a known state, and then restarts normal operation.

      • parse

        public boolean parse()
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ParserException
        Parse input from the scanner that was specified at object construction time. Return whether the end of the input was reached successfully.
        Returns:
        true if the parsing succeeds. Note that this does not imply that there were no syntax errors.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ParserException

      • recoverFromError

        public void recoverFromError()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Attempt to recover from a parsing error. This is unlikely to work in its current state, but what the hey.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • parseNetwork

        public BayesianNetwork parseNetwork()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Parse and return a BayesianNetwork from this BIFParser's input. This method wraps a call to the basic Bison-generated parse() method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Test driver for BIFParser: Parses given file or stdin, prints resulting BN to stdout.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • defineProbabilityTableEntry

        protected void defineProbabilityTableEntry(CPT cpt,
                               Assignment x,
                               java.util.List<RandomVariable> parents,
                               java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Double> ptvalues)
        Recursively traverses parents in the order they were declared (ie., their order in the list), iterating through each of their values, assigning probabilities from ptvalues at the leaves.
